X-Yahoo-Profile: yeah_its_bull

Hiyas,

  Yes, I'm having troubles compiling NEAT.  I am on a windows 
system, and would like some help in getting all the correct packages 
and version etc. in order to compile and run the NEAT experiments.
  I would prefer to use cygwin g++.  Can anybody who has 
successfully compiled NEAT under cygwin tell me the exact versions 
of what I need?  Links to any necessary packages would be good too.
  I think the main problem I am having is incompatible versions of 
libraries and the like.
  I am not fussed about whether or not I use GTK-- or Guile, but I 
would need help in modifying the source code.
  I would like to experiment with NEAT, but after several days of 
compiling problems and reading the archives of this list for help, I 
am nearly ready to give up.
  Something that would be great is a zip file, or similar, where all 
I have to do is uncompress it and then run "make".  Once I can run 
the XOR experiment or similar, then I can focus my attention on 
writing new code for my own experiments rather than spending most of 
the time just trying to get the existing code to work.

Cheers,
Robert.
